http://purl.org/dc/terms/abstract.@value: The Mapping Quality Vocabulary (MQV) provides a set of classes, properties, and restrictions that can be used to represent and interchange provenance and metadata information relating to the quality assessment, quality refinement and quality validation of mapping definitions used to generate Linked data datasets. It can also be specialized to create new classes and properties to model provenance and metadata information for domain specific mapping languages

http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#com.@value: A confidence score rates how successful the framework predicts a refinement will be, at removing a quality violation.
An activity in which the quality of a mapping document is assessed, generating information on quality issues within the mapping.
A mapping document is a document which contains information on how non-RDF data will be transformed to RDF.
An activity which involves removing quality violations contained within a mapping document.
A tool which is used to create or refine a mapping document.
A mapping validation report contains information about quality violations contained within a mapping document.
A mapping violation is a quality issue present within a mapping
A quality measurement calculated during mapping quality assessment.
The type of quality metric. Our implementation focuses on three types, these are mapping, data and vocabulary.
A quality requirement is a requirement a mapping should satisfy.
A query used during the mapping refinement process.
The mapping document being assessed by the mapping quality assessment process.
The agent or mapping quality refinement process who produced the mapping document.
The quality metric being executed by the mapping quality assessment process.
The confidence score of a mapping refinement.
A type assigned to a mapping quality metric. For instance, vocabulary type, for a mapping quality metric, which relates to the vocabulary being used within the mapping.
A measurement calculated  by a quality metric on a mapping document.
The quality requirement of a quality assessment process.
The refinement used for refining a quality violation detcted by a particular quality metric.
A query executed during a refinement.
The mapping quality validation report generated by the quality assessment process.
A mapping quality violation contained within a mapping validation report.
The quality metric which detected a quality violation.
The rationale for the mapping document being created.
The original mapping document, which the refined mapping document was created from.
The agent who executes the mapping quality assessment process.
The mapping document which the mapping quality assessment is being performed on.
Mapping tools which have been used to create a mapping document.
The quality measurement calculated by the mapping quality assessment process.
The refinement used to refine a quality violation.
